data.description: The Saturn Voyager Project aims to explore the moons and rings of Saturn, study its geological features, and analyze its atmosphere.

milestones.name: Mission Planning
milestones.description: Detailed planning of mission objectives, spacecraft requirements, scientific instruments, and mission timeline.

milestones.name: Spacecraft Assembly
milestones.description: Construction and integration of spacecraft components, ensuring adherence to design specifications and quality standards.

milestones.name: Launch and Departure
milestones.description: The spacecraft's liftoff from Earth, marking the beginning of its journey towards Saturn.

milestones.name: Saturn Orbit Insertion
milestones.description: Achieving orbit around Saturn, allowing for close-up observations and data collection.

milestones.name: Moon Flybys
milestones.description: Close flybys of Saturn's moons to study their surface features, composition, and magnetic fields.

milestones.name: Ring System Analysis
milestones.description: Detailed examination of Saturn's ring system to understand its structure, dynamics, and origins.

steps.stepDescription: Launch and ascent to Earth orbit.

data.description: The Perseverance Rover Mission aims to explore the Martian surface, study its geology, search for signs of past life, and prepare for future human exploration.
data.trajectory: Direct route to Mars with aerobraking maneuvers

milestones.name: Mission Planning
milestones.description: Detailed planning of mission objectives, spacecraft requirements, scientific instruments, and mission timeline.

milestones.name: Spacecraft Assembly
milestones.description: Construction and integration of spacecraft components, ensuring adherence to design specifications and quality standards.

milestones.name: Launch and Departure
milestones.description: The spacecraft's liftoff from Earth, marking the beginning of its journey towards Mars.

milestones.name: Mars Orbit Insertion
milestones.description: Achieving orbit around Mars, allowing for close-up observations and data collection.

milestones.name: Sample Collection Begins
milestones.description: Initiation of the rover's mission to collect samples of Martian rocks and regolith for potential return to Earth by a future mission.

milestones.name: First High-Resolution Panorama
milestones.description: Capture and transmission of a high-resolution panoramic image of the rover's surroundings, providing detailed views for scientific analysis and public engagement.

steps.stepDescription: T-Minus 5 minutes: Communication checks with mission control.
T-Minus 1 minute: Final checks and system arming.

data.description: The Exoplanet Survey Mission aims to discover and characterize exoplanets orbiting distant stars, analyze their atmospheres, and assess their potential for hosting life.
data.trajectory: Interplanetary trajectory towards designated exoplanet systems

milestones.name: Mission Planning
milestones.description: Comprehensive planning phase involving the identification of target exoplanet systems, mission objectives, and scientific instruments.

milestones.name: Spacecraft Assembly
milestones.description: Construction and integration of spacecraft components, ensuring functionality and resilience for long-duration space travel.

milestones.name: Launch and Departure
milestones.description: Successful launch from Earth, marking the beginning of the spacecraft's journey towards the selected exoplanet systems.

milestones.name: Interplanetary Transfer
milestones.description: Transition phase where the spacecraft maneuvers through space, utilizing gravitational assists and propulsion systems to reach its destination.

milestones.name: Exoplanet Detection
milestones.description: Commencement of observations and data collection aimed at detecting exoplanets through various techniques, including transit photometry and radial velocity measurements.

milestones.name: Atmospheric Analysis
milestones.description: Detailed study of exoplanetary atmospheres using spectroscopic analysis to identify key molecules and assess habitability.

milestones.name: Biosignature Search
milestones.description: Focused investigation for potential biosignatures in exoplanetary atmospheres, indicative of possible life forms.

steps.stepDescription: Launch and ascent to Earth orbit.
Interplanetary transfer to designated exoplanet systems.

data.description: Apollo 11 was the first crewed mission to land on the Moon, accomplished by NASA in 1969. The mission's primary objective was to perform a crewed lunar landing and return safely to Earth.

milestones.name: Mission Planning
milestones.description: Intensive planning phase commenced to meticulously strategize every aspect of the mission, including crew selection, spacecraft design, and mission objectives.

milestones.name: Spacecraft Assembly
milestones.description: Construction of the spacecraft components and meticulous integration to ensure functionality and structural integrity for the demanding journey ahead.

milestones.name: Launch and Departure
milestones.description: Historic liftoff from Kennedy Space Center, marking the commencement of humanity's journey towards the Moon.

milestones.name: Trans-lunar Injection
milestones.description: Critical maneuver executed to propel the spacecraft out of Earth's orbit and set it on a trajectory towards the Moon.

milestones.name: Lunar Orbit Insertion
milestones.description: Precision maneuver executed to enter lunar orbit, positioning the spacecraft for the subsequent descent to the lunar surface.

milestones.name: Lunar Descent and Landing
milestones.description: Heart-stopping descent to the lunar surface followed by the historic touchdown of the lunar module, Eagle, in the Sea of Tranquility.

milestones.name: Lunar Surface Exploration
milestones.description: Epic moments of exploration as astronauts Neil Armstrong and Edwin 'Buzz' Aldrin become the first humans to set foot on the lunar surface, while Michael Collins orbits above in the command module, Columbia.

milestones.name: Lunar Ascent and Rendezvous
milestones.description: Successful ascent from the lunar surface and rendezvous with the command module in lunar orbit, reuniting the crew for the journey back to Earth.

milestones.name: Return Journey to Earth
milestones.description: Commencement of the return journey to Earth, marking the conclusion of the lunar exploration phase of the mission.

milestones.name: Re-entry and Splashdown
milestones.description: Dramatic re-entry into Earth's atmosphere followed by the safe splashdown of the command module in the Pacific Ocean, concluding the historic Apollo 11 mission.

steps.stepDescription: Trans-lunar injection and trajectory towards the Moon.
Lunar orbit insertion and preparations for landing.
Descent and landing on the lunar surface.
Ascent from the lunar surface to rendezvous with the command module.
Re-entry into Earth's atmosphere and splashdown in the Pacific Ocean.
